root.pub-comments: "The choice of this name should be explained, because other names (Aymara, Aru, Jaqimara) have been used. Because today the Aymara group is by far the largest, it is common practice to refer to the other languages as "dialects" of Aymara. However, the wor
root.publications: Campbell, Lyle. The classification of South American languages. In Lyle Campbell & Verónica Grondona (eds.), South America. Berlin: Mouton de Gruyter. , Hardman, Martha J. 1986. De Donde Vino el Jaqaru, 16. Gainesville, FL: Andean Press Qillq Imprenta. , Hardman, M J. 1975. Proto-Jaqi: reconstrucción del sistema de personas gramaticales, Revista del Museo Nacional, vol. 41, 433-56. , Hardman, M J. 1978. La familia lingüística andina jaqi: jaqaru, kauki, aymara, Vicus Cuardenos: Lingüística, vol. 2, 5-28. , Hardman, M J. 1978. Jaqi: the linguistic family, IJAL, vol. 44, 146-53.

child.pub-comments: Although Kawki and Aymara are more closely related genetically, Kawki and Jaqaru are now in closer contact and share some features to the exclusion of Aymara. "...la relación de las tres lenguas entre sí, con el Jaqaru y el Aymara en los dos extremos de
